routing.community

Class LABELDecisionEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • routing.community.LABELDecisionEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommunityDetectionEngine, RoutingDecisionEngine

    public class LABELDecisionEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements RoutingDecisionEngine, CommunityDetectionEngine

    Implements the LABEL routing protocol described in How Small Labels create Big Improvements by Pan Hui and Jon Crowcroft (2007). The authors found that, where nodes self describe their community with some text label, they are more likely to contact nodes with in their community. While the paper doesn't discuss a protocol that uses programmatic community detection techniques, other papers of the authors reference the idea (though do not specifically present it). Thus, this class is a bit of an extrapolation of their various works on the matter.

    The protocol has each node only forward message to members of the destination's community, i.e. at any given time, if a connected peer declares the destination of a message to be in its local community, then a node decides to transfer the message to that peer.

     \@inproceedings{4144796,
   Author = {Hui, Pan and Crowcroft, Jon},
   Doi = {10.1109/PERCOMW.2007.55},
   Journal = {Pervasive Computing and Communications Workshops, 2007. PerCom 
      Workshops '07. Fifth Annual IEEE International Conference on},
   Month = {March},
   Pages = {65 -70},
   Title = {How Small Labels Create Big Improvements},
   Year = {2007}
 }

      • COMMUNITY_ALG_SETTING

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • community

        protected CommunityDetection community

      • startTimestamps

        protected java.util.Map<DTNHost,java.lang.Double> startTimestamps
        Records the times at which each open connection started. Used to compute the duration of each connection (needed by the community detection algs).

      • connHistory

        protected java.util.Map<DTNHost,java.util.List<Duration>> connHistory
        A record of the entire connection history of this node for the whole simulation. As each connection goes down, a new entry is added into the list for the peer that just disconnected.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LABELDecisionEngine

        public LABELDecisionEngine(Settings s)
        Initializes the decision engine using the given Settings object, extracting the class of community detection algorithm to use. This constructor does NOT create instances of the member fields since this constructor is generally only used to create a "prototype" object that each actual instance replicates.
        Parameters:
        s - Settings from which to get class name

      • LABELDecisionEngine

        Initializes the LABEL decision engine to be a copy of the parameter decision engine.

      • newMessage

        public boolean newMessage(Message m)
        Description copied from interface: RoutingDecisionEngine
        Allows the decision engine to gather information from the given message and determine if it should be forwarded on or discarded. This method is only called when a message originates at the current host (not when received from a peer). In this way, applications can use a Message to communicate information to this routing layer.
        Specified by:
        newMessage in interface RoutingDecisionEngine
        Parameters:
        m - the new Message to consider routing
        Returns:
        True if the message should be forwarded on. False if the message should be discarded.

        Specified by:
        isFinalDest in interface RoutingDecisionEngine
        Parameters:
        m - Message just received
        aHost - Host to check
        Returns:
        true if the given host is a recipient of this given message. False otherwise.
